info.title: Rewards Service
info.description: Service that provides access to onchain, staking-related rewards data.

tags.name: Reward
tags.description: A high-level view of an address's rewards aggregated over some period of time (ex: over an Epoch).

tags.name: Stake
tags.description: A snapshot of an address's staking-related balance at a particular point in time.

get.description: Lists rewards of addresses that have been staked via the Staking API.

400.description: The request attempted has invalid parameters

401.description: Returned if authentication information is invalid

500.description: Returned when an internal server error happens.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token as part of the response of a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the next page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match the previous
request to list resources.

get.description: List portfolios in a CDP organization. Portfolios represent a collection of addresses, grouped together for easier management.

400.description: The request attempted has invalid parameters

401.description: Returned if authentication information is invalid

500.description: Returned when an internal server error happens.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token as part of the response of a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the next page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match the previous
request to list resources.

get.description: Get portfolios in a CDP organization. Portfolios represent a collection of addresses, grouped together for easier management.

400.description: The request attempted has invalid parameters

401.description: Returned if authentication information is invalid

500.description: Returned when an internal server error happens.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description:
The resource name of the stake to retrieve.
Format: portfolios/{portfolio}

get.description: Lists onchain rewards of an address for a specific protocol, with optional filters for time range, aggregation period, and more.

400.description: The request attempted has invalid parameters

401.description: Returned if authentication information is invalid

500.description: Returned when an internal server error happens.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description:
The protocol that the rewards were earned on.
The response will only include rewards for the protocol specified here.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The maximum number of items to return. Maximum size of this value is 500.
If user supplies a value > 500, the API will truncate to 500.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token as part of the response of a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the next page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match the previous
request to list resources correctly.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
[AIP-160](https://google.aip.dev/160) format compliant filter. Supported protocols are 'ethereum', 'solana', and 'cosmos'.
Supplying other protocols will return an error.
* **Ethereum**:
  - Fields:
  - `address` - A ethereum validator public key.
  - `date` - A date in format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Supports multiple comparisons (ex: '2024-01-15).
  - `period_end_time` - A timestamp in RFC-3339 format. Supports multiple comparisons (ex: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' and '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z').
  - Example(s):
  - `"address='0xac53512c39d0081ca4437c285305eb423f474e6153693c12fbba4a3df78bcaa3422b31d800c5bea71c1b017168a60474' AND date >= '2024-01-01' AND date < '2024-01-15'"`
  - `"address='0xac53512c39d0081ca4437c285305eb423f474e6153693c12fbba4a3df78bcaa3422b31d800c5bea71c1b017168a60474' AND period_end_time >= '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' AND period_end_time < '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z'"`
  - `"address='0xac53512c39d0081ca4437c285305eb423f474e6153693c12fbba4a3df78bcaa3422b31d800c5bea71c1b017168a60474' AND date = '2024-01-01'"`

* **Solana**:
  - Fields:
  - `address` - A solana validator or delegator address.
  - `epoch` - A solana epoch. Supports epoch comparisons (ex: `epoch >= 1000 AND epoch <= 2000`).
  - `period_end_time` - A timestamp in RFC-3339 format. Supports multiple comparisons (ex: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' and '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z').
  - Example(s):
  - `"address='beefKGBWeSpHzYBHZXwp5So7wdQGX6mu4ZHCsH3uTar' AND epoch >= 540 AND epoch < 550"`
  - `"address='beefKGBWeSpHzYBHZXwp5So7wdQGX6mu4ZHCsH3uTar' AND period_end_time >= '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' AND period_end_time < '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z'"`
  - `"address='beefKGBWeSpHzYBHZXwp5So7wdQGX6mu4ZHCsH3uTar' AND epoch = 550"`

* **Cosmos**:
  - Fields:
  - `address` - A cosmos validator or delegator address (ex: `cosmosvaloper1c4k24jzduc365kywrsvf5ujz4ya6mwympnc4en` and `cosmos1c4k24jzduc365kywrsvf5ujz4ya6mwymy8vq4q`)
  - `date` - A date in format 'YYYY-MM-DD'. Supports multiple comparisons (ex: '2024-01-15).
  - `period_end_time` - A timestamp in RFC-3339 format. Supports multiple comparisons (ex: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' and '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z').
  - Example(s):
  - `"address='cosmos1mfduj0qax6ut8rd6cfc4j0ds06z0mwlhrljhqh' AND date = '2024-11-16'"`
  - `"address='cosmos1mfduj0qax6ut8rd6cfc4j0ds06z0mwlhrljhqh' AND period_end_time >= '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' AND period_end_time < '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z'"`
  - `"address='cosmos1mfduj0qax6ut8rd6cfc4j0ds06z0mwlhrljhqh' AND date = '2024-01-01'"`

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
The order in which to sort the results.
[AIP-132](https://google.aip.dev/132) compliant order_by field.
The default behavior, if not supplied, is 'period_end_time desc'.
Example(s):
* 'period_end_time desc', which returns Rewards starting with the most recent.
* 'period_end_time asc', which returns Rewards starting with the oldest available.
* 'period_end_time', which returns Rewards starting with the oldest available.

get.description: Lists staking balance of a protocol, with optional filters for time range and address.

400.description: The request attempted has invalid parameters

401.description: Returned if authentication information is invalid

500.description: Returned when an internal server error happens.

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description:
The protocol that the staking balance exists on.
The response will only include staking balances for the protocol specified here.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token as part of the response of a previous call.
Provide this to retrieve the next page.

When paginating, all other parameters must match the previous
request to list resources.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
[AIP-160](https://google.aip.dev/160) format compliant filter. Supported protocols are 'ethereum', 'solana'.
Supplying other protocols will return an error.
* **Ethereum**:
  - Fields:
  - `address` - A ethereum validator public key.
  - `evaluation_time` - A timestamp in RFC-3339 format. Supports multiple comparisons (ex: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' and '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z').
  - Example(s):
  - `"address='0xac53512c39d0081ca4437c285305eb423f474e6153693c12fbba4a3df78bcaa3422b31d800c5bea71c1b017168a60474'"`
  - `"address='0xac53512c39d0081ca4437c285305eb423f474e6153693c12fbba4a3df78bcaa3422b31d800c5bea71c1b017168a60474' AND evaluation_time >= '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' AND evaluation_time < '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z'"`

* **Solana**:
  - Fields:
  - `address` - A solana staking address.
  - `evaluation_time` - A timestamp in RFC-3339 format. Supports multiple comparisons (ex: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' and '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z').
  - Example(s):
  - `"address='beefKGBWeSpHzYBHZXwp5So7wdQGX6mu4ZHCsH3uTar'"`
  - `"address='beefKGBWeSpHzYBHZXwp5So7wdQGX6mu4ZHCsH3uTar' AND evaluation_time >= '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z' AND evaluation_time < '2024-01-15T00:00:00Z'"`

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description:
The order in which to sort the results.
[AIP-132](https://google.aip.dev/132) compliant order_by field.
The default behavior, if not supplied, is 'evaluation_time desc'.
Example(s):
* 'evaluation_time desc', which returns Stakes starting with the most recent.
* 'evaluation_time asc', which returns Stakes starting with the oldest available.
* 'evaluation_time', which returns Stakes starting with the oldest available.

RewardRateCalculationMethods.description:
Representing the different methods of calculating yield.

 - CALCULATION_METHODS_UNSPECIFIED: Calculation method is unknown or unspecified.
 - SOLO_STAKER: A single Ethereum validator acting in isolation is currently not able to compound earned rewards because
Ethereum only allows validators to stake 32 ETH precisely.
This percentage yield is assuming that the rewards never compound, mimicking the behavior of a solo staker.
 - POOLED_STAKER: A pool of Ethereum validators of sufficient size is able to compound rewards almost immediately.
This percentage yield is assuming rewards compound immediately, mimicking the behavior of a sufficiently large pool.
 - EPOCH_AUTO_COMPOUNDING: A Solana delegator's staking rewards are staked (and therefore auto-compound) when rewards are paid out between epochs.
This percentage yield is assuming the rewards are auto-compounded on that schedule, mimicking a Solana delegator.
 - NO_AUTO_COMPOUNDING: A Solana validator's rewards accumulate in a separate account from the validator's active stake.
This percentage yield is assuming the rewards are not auto-compounded at any point, mimicking a Solana validator who never staked their rewards.

RewardState.description:
The state that a reward can potentially be in.
Not all rewards are immediately usable and accessible which is
protocol dependent.

 - STATE_UNSPECIFIED: The reward state is in an unspecified state.
 - PENDING_CLAIMABLE: Indicates a reward that is not liquid and not on a users wallet address.
Typically the user would need to perform a transaction to claim their reward.
e.g. For Ethereum Partial Staking, the user must unstake then claim their rewards, each
being it's own transaction on-chain to ultimately receive their rewards.
 - MATERIALIZED: Indicates a reward that is liquid and has been paid out to the users wallet address which
is usually done by an explicit blockchain transaction.
e.g. Solana rewards are paid out per epoch directly to the stake account address.

amount.title: Amount of delegation received or given

StakeDelegation.description: A single delegation from one address to another.

USDValueSource.description:
The source of the USD price conversion.

 - SOURCE_UNSPECIFIED: The USD value source is unknown or unspecified.
 - COINBASE_EXCHANGE: The USD value source is the Coinbase exchange.

protocol.title: The protocol of this particular address

v1Address.description: Represents an address on any protocol.

v1AggregationUnit.description:
The unit of time that the reward events were aggregated by.

 - AGGREGATION_UNIT_UNSPECIFIED: Aggregation unit is unknown or unspecified.
 - EPOCH: Indicates the rewards are aggregated by epoch. This means there will be a 'epoch' field displaying the epoch on this resource.
 - DAY: Indicates the rewards are aggregated by day. This means there will be a 'date' field displaying the date on this resource.

amount.title:
The amount of the asset in the most common denomination.
Ex: ETH (converted from gwei)
Ex: USD (converted from fractional pennies)

exp.description:
The number of decimals needed to convert from the raw numeric value to the most
common denomination.

ticker.description: The ticker of this asset (ex: USD, ETH, SOL).

rawNumeric.description:
The raw, unadulterated numeric value.
Ex: Wei (in Ethereum) and Lamports (in Solana).

v1AssetAmount.description: Amount encapsulation for a given asset.

portfolioRewards.description: The rewards returned in this response.

nextPageToken.description: The page token the user must use in the next request if the next page is desired.

v1ListPortfolioRewardsResponse.description:
The response to a ListPortfolioRewardRequest.
Contains a list of rewards associated with the addresses in a portfolio.

portfolios.description: The portfolios returned in this response.

nextPageToken.description: The page token the user must use in the next request if the next page is desired.

rewards.description: The rewards returned in this response.

nextPageToken.description: The page token the user must use in the next request if the next page is desired.

stakes.description: The staking balances returned in this response.

nextPageToken.description: The page token the user must use in the next request if the next page is desired.

v1ParticipantType.description:
The participant type of a staking-related address.

 - PARTICIPANT_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: The participant type is unknown.
 - DELEGATOR: Used when the onchain participant type is a delegator
(i.e. someone who delegates the responsibilities of validating blocks to another address in return for a share of the rewards).
 - VALIDATOR: Used when the onchain participant type is a validator
(i.e. an address that is directly responsible for performing validation of blocks).

name.description: A unique identifier for the portfolio.

addresses.title: The addresses that make up the portfolio

v1Portfolio.description:
A portfolio represents an arbitrary collection of addresses. A portfolio doesn't necessarily
imply that the underlying addresses are linked onchain in any manner.
A portfolio is a convenient way for users to group addresses together for reporting purposes.
For now, project and portfolio are synonymous, 1-to-1.

v1ProtocolName.description:
The complete list of supported protocols.

 - PROTOCOL_NAME_UNSPECIFIED: The protocol isn't defined
 - SOLANA: The Solana protocol
 - COSMOS: The Cosmos protocol
 - ETHEREUM: The Ethereum protocol

address.description: The address that earned this reward.

epoch.description: A unique identifier for the consensus-cycle of the blockchain.

date.description: The date of the reward in format 'YYYY-MM-DD' in UTC.

aggregationUnit.description:
The unit of time that the reward events were rolled up by.
Can be either "epoch" or "daily".

periodStartTime.description:
The starting time of this reward period. Returned when querying by epoch.
Timestamps are in UTC, conforming to the RFC-3339 spec (e.g. 2024-11-13T19:38:36Z).
Field currently unavailable. Coming soon.

periodEndTime.description:
The ending time of this reward period. Returned when querying by epoch.
Timestamps are in UTC, conforming to the RFC-3339 spec (e.g. 2024-11-13T19:38:36Z).

totalEarnedNativeUnit.description:
The amount earned in this time period in the native unit of the protocol.
This is the net amount earned, meaning the amount that was actually paid out to the address.
If the rewards had a commission or fee taken out before it landed on this address, that commission amount is not included here.

totalEarnedNativeUnitGross.description:
This is the gross amount earned, meaning the total amount of rewards that is attributable to the staking activity of this address.
This amount includes any commission or fee taken out before it landed on this address.

totalEarnedUsd.description:
The amount earned in this time period in USD.
If multiple different price sources are used, then multiple USD values will be returned.
Total USD value is calculated by getting each individual reward components in this time period and summing the USD value of each individual component.
USD value is calculates at the time each component was earned.

endingBalance.description:
A snapshot of the staking balance the end of this period.
Field currently unavailable. Coming soon.

protocol.description: The protocol on which this reward was earned.

rewardState.description: The state that the reward is in when calculated.

v1Reward.description:
Rewards earned via onchain staking-related activites.
A reward may be a particular event or a rollup of multiple events (ex: rewards earned in a day).

percentage.description: The percentage rate of rewards calculation. Will include two digits after the decimal (ex: 3.05).

calculatedTime.description:
The time at which this yield calculation was calculated.
Timestamps are in UTC, conforming to the RFC-3339 spec (e.g. 2023-11-13T19:38:36Z).

calculationMethod.description:
The method used to calculate this yield. This could include information about which
rewards we're including in the calculation, how we're estimating the compounding period, etc.

v1RewardRate.description: Reward yield calculation at a given point in time.

address.description: The address of the staking balance.

evaluationTime.description:
The time at which this balance was evaluated.
Timestamps are in UTC, conforming to the RFC-3339 spec (e.g. 2023-11-13T19:38:36Z).

bondedStake.description:
The total amount of stake that is actively earning rewards to this address.
Includes any delegated stake and self-stake.
For delegators, this would be only the amount delegated to a validator in most cases.
Only includes stake that is *actively contributing to rewards and can't be reduced
without affecting the rewards dynamics*.

Pending inactive stake is included.
Pending active stake is not included.

totalDelegationReceived.description:
The amount of stake that this address receives from other addresses.
For most delegators, this will be 0. For validators, this will be the total amount of stake delegated to them.

delegationsReceived.title: The list of individual delegations this address has received from other addresses

delegationsGiven.description: The amount that this address stakes to another address.

rewardRateCalculations.description: An estimated yield of this address.

participantType.description: The participant type at the time of evaluation (i.e. validator, delegator).

protocol.description: The protocol on which this staking balance exists.

unbondedBalance.description:
The amount of stake that is not actively earning rewards to this address.
This amount includes any native token balance that is under the domain and control of the address in question,
but is not actively staked.

Pending active stake would be included here.

v1Stake.description: The representation of a staking balance at a particular point in time.

source.description: The source of the USD price conversion. Could be internal to Coinbase, and external source, or any other source.

conversionTime.description:
The timestamp at which the USD value was sourced to convert the value into USD.
This value is as close to the time the reward was earned as possible.
Timestamps are in UTC, conforming to the RFC-3339 spec (e.g. 2024-11-13T19:38:36Z).

amount.description: The USD value of the reward at the conversion time.

conversionPrice.description: The price of the native unit at the conversion time.

v1USDValue.description: Information regarding the USD value of a reward, with necessary context and metadata.
